ngiemboon: Á laa fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, Melondag-Mbalandaŋ gẅie aa fùɔ Mbambilonia, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Mbalandaŋ, á túmo tàʼ ŋwàʼne pɔ́ mmó nanǎ á mbwó Ezekiyásè, ńtí nue à ka jǔʼ páʼ à ka guɔ tà sẅéte.
en: At that time   Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah since he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.

ngiemboon: Anò poŋo Ezekiyásè, tà á nyɛ ntaŋ wé gẅie nkáb, lâ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ tà mbɔɔ shúm gyě ée tsoló á mbwó memántúm; ńgíŋ ńnyɛ mevɛ́ gyě mbwó pɔ́b, tà mbɔɔ shúm ncù sé ntsèm, ḿbú nyɛɛ wɔ́b shúm ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ntaŋ wé. Atsɔ́ mmó gie Ezekiyásè la lÿoon wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ndá yé, tà mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ yé, á la te wó wɔ́.
en: Hezekiah was pleased with the letters, and he showed the envoys his treasure house #— #the silver, the gold, the spices, and the precious oil #— #and all his armory, and everything that was found in his treasuries.   There was nothing in his palace and in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.  # 39:2 2Ch 32:25

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo púʼu, Esǎyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé tó ńgyá fùɔ Ezekiyásè, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Epʉ̀a pɔɔn shwoŋó gú ngie kɔ́? Pɔ́ fóo pɔ́ lé nzɔ̌?» Fùɔ Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pɔ́ fǒ tàa Mbambilonia, ńtóo légyá wɔ́ɔn.»
en: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked him, “What did these men say, and where did they come to you from? ”

ngiemboon: Esǎyà gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie: «Pɔ́ gyá kɔ́ ndá gù?» Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pɔ́ gyǎ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa ndá mèŋ. Atsɔ́ mmó gie n dÿǒon wɔ́b á na shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sɔ́ɔn, á te wó wɔ́.»
en: Isaiah asked, “What have they seen in your palace? ”

ngiemboon: Esǎyà leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Ezekiyásè ngie: «Júʼu shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ:
en: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of Armies:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ge gÿo gwɔ́, mé túʼ shúm sɛ̂ ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼɔ jú, ńdɔg ńgʉa né Mbambilonia. É shúm sie mefùɔ pie é la vɔg sáʼa láʼ tá ɔ̀ néŋe jú, la pú cúʼte. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn ngie lagá mmó té láʼ vwɔʼɔ wɔ́.
en: ‘Look, the days are coming when everything in your palace and all that your predecessors have stored up until today will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mé ge gÿo lɔg tsɔ́ na gubé jú gie ɔ̀ zyě, é gʉa né nɔʼɔ Mbambilonia, pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ pamentsìndá.»
en: ‘Some of your descendants #— #who come from you, whom you father #— #will be taken away, and they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Esǎyà ngie: «Wɔɔn nkʉ̀ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tǔm, ɔ̀ tsẅi né mèŋ lɔɔn, ée mbòŋ.» Ezekiyásè la gwaa gɔɔn púʼu, ńne ńkwaŋa ntʉ́m yé ngie à ge néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè, mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né yé á na mé melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord that you have spoken is good,” for he thought: There will be peace and security during my lifetime.
